<blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">If you want to be a good data scientist, you should spend ~49% of your time developing your statistical intuition (i.e. how to ask good questions of the data), and ~49% of your time on domain knowledge (improving overall understanding of your field).
